means: 色雷斯（自爱琴海至多瑙河的巴尔干半岛东南部地区）

sentence.Network_en: When Athens was threatened by the wild men, King Tereus of Thrace came to its help.
sentence.Network_cn: 当雅典受到蛮人的威胁时, 色雷斯国王泰诺斯伸出了援助之手.

sentence.Network_en: It is also possible that viticultural knowledge reached Greece via Asia Minor or Thrace.
sentence.Network_cn: 可能葡萄的栽培技术是从小亚细亚,或色累斯传入希腊的.

sentence.Network_en: For years they lived in Thrace and had one son, Itylus by name.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在色雷斯生活了许多年,并且生了一个儿子, 名叫意大拉斯.

means.word_mean: 1. a region and ancient country and wine producing region in the east of the Balkan Peninsula north of the Aegean Sea; colonized by ancient Greeks; later a Roman province; now divided between Bulgaria and Greece and Turkey
